title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 473.4 - Changes in application
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 473.4 - Changes in application

State Regulations
(a) Any
change relating to the information contained in the application blank must be
reported immediately to the State Tax Commission, Miscellaneous Tax Bureau. Thus, any change in the applicant's business or other address, or in the name
or ownership of its business must be so reported. (b) In addition, if a motor vehicle for which
a permit has been issued is transferred or junked or if the business of a
permit holder is sold, the commission should be notified promptly. In such
cases, any permits, plates and stickers, issued to the carrier must be
surrendered within five days thereafter. (See section
474.6, infra.)
(c) All correspondence, including blank tax return forms, from the commission will be mailed to the
business address shown on the permit application unless the applicant notifies
the commission of a change of address. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
473.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
